wikipedia_page.main: Grace W. Pailthorpe (29 July 1883 – 19 July 1971) was a British surrealist painter, surgeon, and psychology researcher.

response: * Grace Pailthorpe (1883–1971), British surrealist painter, surgeon, and psychology researcher.

link_mentions.page: Centre for Crime and Justice Studies
response: The organisation was established in July 1931 by Grace Pailthorpe (who was a surgeon during the First World War, a Freudian psychotherapist, and later a surrealist artist) as the Association for the Scientific Treatment of Criminals. It was renamed in July 1932 to the Institute for the Scientific Treatment of Delinquency, and to the Institute for the Study and Treatment of Delinquency (ISTD) in 1951, adopting its current name in 1999."History of CCJS". Centre for Crime and Justice Studies. Retrieved 28 October 2010. Archived by WebCite on 28 October 2010.

link_mentions.page: List of painters by name beginning with "P"

response: In 1983 he opened his first gallery, James Birch Fine Art, on the King's Road, London, where he specialised in the work of British surrealists such as John Banting, Eileen Agar, Conroy Maddox and Grace Pailthorpe, the Symbolist and magician Austin Osman Spare and the artist and muse Luciana Martinez de la Rosa.Dick Jewell, "Luciana PV", Vimeo, March 2017Mike Von Joel, "The Pimpernel Curator", f22, July 2011

Birch regularly lends art works to art institutions and galleries for major and small scale exhibitions. Some of the recent ones include; Grayson Perry: The Pre-Therapy Years at The Holburne Museum Bath (24 January - 25 May 2020)  , Modern Couples Art, Intimacy and the Avant-garde at Barbican Art Gallery (10 Oct 2018—27 Jan 2019), A Tale of Mother’s Bones: Grace Pailthorpe, Reuben Mednikoff and the Birth of Psychorealism a travelling show presented at the De La Warr Pavilion, (6 October 2018 – 20 January 2019), the Camden Arts Centre, (12 April – 23 June 2019)https://www.camdenartscentre.org/whats-on/view/pmednikoff
